subclassFeatures: Harbinger of the Blue Breath of Change|Sorcerer|PHB|The Spellscarred|TSSO|18

subclassFeature.name: The Spellscarred
entries: Adistant time ago, blue flame ravaged the lands as The Weave tore itself apart. Towering flames shaped and changed Faerun for better and for worst. Many users of magic perished, as their spells were like fuel to the fire that raged across the lands. Those that were engulfed in it, and called upon magic near it, paid a terrible price. It has been years since, but there are rumors that essences of the Spellplague remaining, tiny corners in the world that still host a flickering blue flame, any that go near them, or cast spells near them, runs the risk of becoming Spellscarred.
Spellscarred are seen similar to lepers, carrying an incredibly dangerous force that they can barely control. The life of a Spellscarred is lonely, as it is so rare to have this condition.

entries.name: Features
entries: A spellscar has different effects on its wielder based on how it was attained. Were you tossed into the flame, brought your hand just too close to it, or were you born within sight of it. Spellscars do not always grant the powers of a sorcerer, but may give small yet not worthy abilities.
You can apply these features to the sorcerer: {@i Reaching Embers},  {@i Bite of the Blue Burn},  {@i Eyes of Revealing Fire}

entries.name: Magic Items
entries: Rarely, the Spellplague's flames have been wielded by artificers and wizards working to bend some of its power to their will. These items are of notably rarity, and their power is indeed great.

entries.name: Spellscarred in Other Settings
entries: The Spellplague is only mentioned in the Forgotten Realms setting, but a Spellscarred individual could have come from other means. A terrible accident in a magical laboratory, a gift from a less than loving patron, or simply waking up with one. The options are limitless.

entries.name: Heralds of the Blue Fire
entries: This order was once a philanthropic group that tended to the victims of the Spellplague. They took in survivors and Spellscarred, and seeked the flames to better alert the world of their locations and terrible powers.

Whether it was their intention in the beginning, or became corrupted, the order was outed as a fanatical cult, taking in Spellscarred, and using them to spread the Spellplague further than it had reached.

Nowadays they are forgotten by the public, but work in secret to keep the remaining bastions of Spellplague alive in the world. Many Spellscarred join their ranks, but some do desert, realizing what they are doing could lead to disaster.

subclassFeature.name: Touch of the Flame
entries: You have become spellscarred, somewhere on your body rests a brand, a blue flame that holds to your body or replaces part of your body. Whether it be on your forehead, your arm, your leg, and quite possibly your entire form, it will always mark you and follow you.

Those that know your mark may avoid you, or attempt to study you, as your kind is so rare. There are some that may worship you, aim to get closer to you, or very well kill you, knowing the power that rests in you is not only ancient, but powerful. The only definite in the future of a Spellscarred, is that there is no changing back.

The spellscar counts as a curse on a creature, but cannot be removed with spells such as {@spell remove curse|PHB}, even the {@spell wish|PHB} spell cannot save you from this, as the fire feeds off of magic itself and only will work against the magic that tries to fight it.
When detect magic is used in the area, your mark will flare as magical, counting as abjuration magic when inspected.

subclassFeature.name: Fuel to the Fire
entries: At 1st level, your spellscar keeps you resilient to magic, when you are affected by a spell of 1st level or higher, you can use your reaction to empower your spellscar and gain resistance to one type of the damage dealt if damage was done. When you use this, your spellscar flares, and you can use one of your Spellscarred Powers up until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Headlamp
entries: At 1st level, your spellscar softly glows, casting dimlight from you in a 5 ft. radius. Without needing to use an action or bonus action you can turn this light to bright light out to a 5 foot radius with dim light another 5 feet beyond that. This light can never be put out, only concealed by clothing. The flames do not cause harm to creatures or objects, but an uncomfortable warmth can sometimes be felt by the wielder of the spellscar.

subclassFeature.name: Spellscar Powers
entries: Your spellscar is able to grant you powers as magic is used against it and allow you to master its disruptive power. At 1st level you gain two of these abilities, and can choose an additional at 6th, 14th, and 18th level.
You can use only one spellscar power per turn, regardless of action or bonus action. When you have a Spellscar Power active, you cannot activate another unless you cancel the current power.

You can use only one spellscar power per turn, regardless of action or bonus action. When you have a Spellscar Power active, you cannot activate another unless you cancel the current power.
You can have 5 powers from the list:

subclassFeature.name: A Flash of Anger
entries: At 6th level, you can use your bonus action and two sorcery points to have your Spellscar flare menacingly, you gain advantage on any Intimidation checks against creatures that can see you this turn.

subclassFeature.name: Aegis of the Spellplague
entries: At 10th level when your Fuel to the Fire activates, you can grant that same resistance to allies within 10 feet of you.
Your Headlamp feature also can now cast bright light in a 10 foot range, with dim light 10 feet beyond that.

subclassFeature.name: Harbinger of the Blue Breath of Change
entries: At 18th level, your Spellscar can call upon a column of Spellplague on a location to bring long forgotten ruin. At a point you can see within 120 feet, a column of blue fire errupts from the ground, burning all in its space.

The cylinder has a radius of 20 feet, but has a height of 300 feet. If the flames hit a cieling they do not go further, but they do go around cover as long as there is a path. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity Saving Throw against your Sorcerer Spell Save DC or take {@damage 12d6} Fire Damage, and suffer the following effect. You can only use this ability once, and regain use of it at the end of a long rest.

Targets cannot cast spells, cannot activate magic items, and lose concentration on any spells being concentrated on instantly. Any spells that are currently affecting the creature end as if a successful Dispel Magic was cast on them. These effects last until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Fuel to the Fire
entries: At 1st level, your spellscar keeps you resilient to magic, when you are affected by a spell of 1st level or higher, you can use your reaction to empower your spellscar and gain resistance to one type of the damage dealt if damage was done. When you use this, your spellscar flares, and you can use one of your {@i Spellscarred} Powers up until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Headlamp
entries: At 1st level, your spellscar softly glows, casting dimlight from you in a 5 ft. radius. Without needing to use an action or bonus action you can turn this light to bright light out to a 5 foot radius with dim light another 5 feet beyond that. This light can never be put out, only concealed by clothing. The flames do not cause harm to creatures or objects, but an uncomfortable warmth can sometimes be felt by the wielder of the spellscar.

optionalfeature.name: Burning Resolve
entries: You can use a bonus action to ready yourself for the next spell, choose a saving throw, when you are forced to resist a magical effect using that saving throw within the next minute, you can use your reaction to choose to automatically succeed. After using the effect the Power ends.

optionalfeature.name: Armor of Fire
entries: Your spellscar hums, ready to protect you and it from attacks with disorientating flames, you can use a bonus action to gain a bonus to your AC equal to your proficiency bonus for the next minute. You can use your reaction to double this bonus for a single attack, but doing so ends the effect after the attack no matter the time remaining.

optionalfeature.name: Disruptive Burn
entries: You can make a special attack as your spellscar's flames encoat your hand, teeth, horns, etc. You can use an action to make a melee spell attack, if you hit, you brand the individual with a temporary spellscar, they take fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier, and on concentration checks they must beat your Spell Save DC unless the concentration check calls for a higher roll. They must also make a spellcasting ability check against your Spell Save DC the first time they try to cast a spell of 1st level or higher.
This spellscar counts as a curse, and can be removed with spells such as remove curse. This lasts for one minute.

optionalfeature.name: Cooperative Flame
entries: You can use an action to touch another creature and give them a temporary spellscar that grants a small benefit, this spellscar grants a bonus equal to half your proficiency bonus rounded down to saving throws for the next hour.
This spellscar counts as a curse, and can be removed with spells such as {@spell remove curse|PHB}. This lasts for one minute.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Life
entries: You can cast the {@spell Find Familiar|PHB} spell as an action instead of the normal casting time, creating a creature that exists by your flame. Whatever creature you create, it has the {@b {@i Headlamp feature}}. The spell lasts for eight hours, and counts as abjuration magic instead of conjuration.

optionalfeature.name: Gaze of the Plague
entries: You can grant yourself darkvision as your eyes become backlit with flame. You gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet, if you already have darkvision, the range doubles to a maximum of 120 feet. This lasts for one hour.

optionalfeature.name: A Burning Sensation
entries: When you hit with a weapon attack, you temporarily give them a spellscar, whenever they take damage, an additional 1 fire damage is dealt. This lasts for 1 minute.
This spellscar counts as a curse, and can be removed with spells such as {@spell remove curse|PHB}. This lasts for one minute.

feat.name: Reaching Embers
entries: Your spellscarred arms can distend from their normal proportions, giving you an advantage in combat.

items: Once per round when you make a melee attack, you can attack 5 feet further than your normal distance.
You can also extend your arms much further, but much more sparingly. You can increase the range of a melee weapon attack to 30 feet, but only once per long rest.

feat.name: Bite of the Blue Burn
entries: Your spellscarred jaw can extend, giving you a terrible bite that curses the target.

items: You gain a special melee attack called {@b {@i Bite of the Blue Burn}}, it can be substituted for a normal weapon attack much like grappling or shoving.
When you make this attack, you use Strength and are considered proficient with this attack, the damage deals {@damage 1d4} plus Strength.

If you hit with this attack, the creature is grappled and the target loses resistance to one damage type of your choice. The grapple can end without action, and the curse ends immediately as the grapple does.
This effect counts as a curse against the target, and can be removed with spells such as {@spell Remove Curse|PHB}.

feat.name: Eyes of Revealing Fire
entries: Your spellscarred eyes can momentarily see through lies and deceit, both magical and social.

items: You have advanatage on Investigation (Intelligence) checks against telling if something is an illusion.

You can use a bonus action to flare your Spellscarred eyes. You see through illusions, and invisible creatures and objects are revealed to you. This lasts for 1 minute. You can use this feature once per short or long rest.

item.name: Ring of Azure Flames
entries: This ring has a pale blue metal band, and adorning it is a small goblet holding a tiny flame of blue. The wielder can cast the {@spell Resistance|PHB} Cantrip, and can cast the spells {@spell Counterspell|PHB} or {@spell Dispel Magic|PHB} once per day. If the magic is successfully dispelled, then either of the spells can be cast once again.
If the dispel fails, the ring can work once again at dawn.

item.name: Robe of the Spellplague
entries: This cloak is lit aflame with blue fire, while wearing the cloak, unless concealed, you emit bright light in a 30 ft. radius, and dim light 30 ft. beyond that.

This item has three charges. When you are targeted by a spell or magical effect and are put to making a saving throw, you can use your reaction and a charge to automatically succeed on the saving throw. You can use this effect three times until the next dawn. At dawn the cloak regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges.
This weapon is adorned in blue flames softly lighting the area around it, and those hit by it are disrupted by its antimagic effects.

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. The weapon emits bright light In addition, when you hit an enemy with a weapon attack that is concentrating on a spell, the target has disadvantage on the following concentration check to keep spells from ending from the attack.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The Spellscarred hound has advantage on Wisdom(Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Magical Resistance
entries: The Spellscarred Hound has advantage on saving throws against spells.

trait.name: Headlamp
entries: If not concealed, the spellscar emitts dim light out to a range of 5 ft.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The hound has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Burning Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.
{@b Spellscarred NPCs}
The life of the Spellscarred can be difficult, and difficult lives can drive creatures to harsh deeds. Though there are exceptions, it is wise to keep your eye on wielders of the blue flames.
{@b Spellscarred Beasts}

Many beasts that roam the wilds can happen upon a location still infested with the spellplague, and they also can be cursed by the blue fire. Spellscarred beasts have been ostrasized by their groups, but have also taken dominance, the only difference being if the wielder of the Spellscar can bear the weight.

entries.name: Making Spellscarred Monsters
entries: To change nonhumanoid monsters to give them a spellscar there are four steps, change the type to monstrosity, unless rangers are able to take Spellscarred beasts in your game. Give {@i Magical Resistance} to show their ability to negate spells, give them the {@i Headlamp} ability, and add fire damage to attacks to match the Monster Statistics by Challenge Rating Table in the {@i Dungeon Master's Guide}.

trait.name: Magical Resistance
entries: The Spellscarred Drifter has advantage on saving throws against spells.

trait.name: Headlamp
entries: If not concealed, the spellscar emitts dim light out to a range of 5 feet.

trait.name: Cursed Form
entries: Spells such as {@spell Hex|PHB} and {@spell Bestow Curse|PHb} fail to effect this creature.

action.name: Fire Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, plus 5 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Rage of Fire {@recharge 5}
entries: The Spellscarred puts his hands together, thumbs connecting, and ejects blue flames from his finger tips and spellscar out in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the space must make a Dexterity Saving Throw {@dc 13} or take 17 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage.
{@b Spellscarred Humanoids}

The most often creatures that are effected by the Spellplague, humanoids are the perfect conduit for the spreading of the Spellplague. Many with the blue flames are no longer with their original home, but cults that worship the Spellplague do exist, and take in those with the gift.

entries: The Herald perminantly has the spell {@spell Mage Armor} cast on him at all times.

trait.name: Quick Casting (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action The Herald can cast a spell that has a cost of 1 action. The spell cannot be higher than 1st-level.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The herald is a 5th-level spellscaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (Spell Save {@dc 14}, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The herald has the following sorcerer spells.
